trans-unit.source: In relation to a customer or customer group there might be delivery arrangements for the shelf life of an item. This guaranteed remaining shelf time is usually arranged between manufacturers and wholesalers.

seg-source.mrk: In relation to a customer or customer group there might be delivery arrangements for the shelf life of an item.
This guaranteed remaining shelf time is usually arranged between manufacturers and wholesalers.

trans-unit.source: When creating a sales line, the system checks if a remaining shelf time has been defined for the combination of customer and item / item category. If the item to be sold will expire within the denoted period, the system displays a warning message when assigning the lot number. The remaining shelf time is added to the Planned Delivery Date or – if existing – the Promised Delivery Date.

seg-source.mrk: When creating a sales line, the system checks if a remaining shelf time has been defined for the combination of customer and item / item category.
If the item to be sold will expire within the denoted period, the system displays a warning message when assigning the lot number.
The remaining shelf time is added to the Planned Delivery Date or – if existing – the Promised Delivery Date.

trans-unit.source: To use this functionality, the shelf time must be defined on the Remain. Shelf Life Setup page, accessed from the Navigate tab on either the Customer Card or Item Card.

seg-source.mrk: To use this functionality, the shelf time must be defined on the <span class="Bold">Remain.
Shelf Life Setup page, accessed from the Navigate tab on either the Customer Card or Item Card.

trans-unit.source: : Remain. Shelf Life Setup page opened from Customer Card

seg-source.mrk: Shelf Life Setup page opened from Customer Card

trans-unit.source: Similar to Sales Prices or Line Discounts, customer and item filtering can be set in the header and then the lines contain the customer/item combination with the specified remaining shelf time.

seg-source.mrk: Similar to Sales Prices or Line Discounts, customer and item filtering can be set in the header and then the lines contain the customer/item combination with the specified remaining shelf time.

trans-unit.source: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref314489225" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 1</MadCap:xref>, when sold to customer 10000, item P-10503 has a remaining shelf time of 60 days. This means that if a lot of item P-10503 is set to expire within 60 days of delivery to customer 10000, a warning message will appear when the lot is entered for the sales line. The warning message is calculated by Warning Date (Expiration Date - Remaining Shelf Time) < Planned Delivery Date.

seg-source.mrk: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref314489225" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 1</MadCap:xref>, when sold to customer 10000, item P-10503 has a remaining shelf time of 60 days.
This means that if a lot of item P-10503 is set to expire within 60 days of delivery to customer 10000, a warning message will appear when the lot is entered for the sales line.
The warning message is calculated by Warning Date (Expiration Date - Remaining Shelf Time) < Planned Delivery Date.

trans-unit.source: : Warning message received when planned delivery date is within specified warning date range

seg-source.mrk: : Warning message received when planned delivery date is within specified warning date range

trans-unit.source: This is only a warning message; it does not prevent the delivery to the customer.

seg-source.mrk: This is only a warning message; it does not prevent the delivery to the customer.
